Description:
Eastside Pre-Primary and Primary School gives children from Grade RRR to Grade 7 a firm foundation of Christian education and faith. The school’s vision is aligned with that of Eastside Community Church to bring Hope and Salvation and our mission is to Establish learners in the love of God and empower them to live wholehearted and successful lives.We want every child to be emotionally confident, spiritually secure, able to reason clearly and solve problems creatively. We want every child to love God, and love the way He made them, celebrate the differences in others and confront conflict calmly and competently.We want every child to value the natural environment and protect the future for their children. We want every child to love learning and to use ‘failures’ as steppingstones towards excellence. We want every child to be able to face an uncertain future with courage and fortitude.Based in the East of Pretoria, the school was founded as a nursery school in 1970 and in 2020 the Grade 7 class was added making Eastside into a full Primary school. We pride ourselves on providing good quality Christian education at affordable prices. We are an independent English medium Christian school. We follow the CAPS curriculum, and we are affiliated with the IEB. We incorporate the Bible into everything we teach. In order to give the children a well-rounded education, we offer dance, drama, music, Kindergym and chess classes by specialised teachers.Sport at Eastside is compulsory. We have beautiful sports fields and participate in many inter-school sporting activities including soccer, cricket, netball and athletics.At Eastside School every day is open day. Please do not hesitate to contact us to book your private guided tour of the school.850 Primula Rd, Garsfontein, Pretoria, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 2:30 pmTuesday7:00 am - 2:30 pmWednesday7:00 am - 2:30 pmThursday7:00 am - 2:30 pmFriday7:00 am - 2:30 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
The primary goal of a Montessori program is to help each child reach its full potential in all areas of life. The method of Montessori is based on three key factors; the specialized training of the teacher, a specially prepared environment complete with Montessori apparatus and a multi age grouping of children. When these elements are in place, young children are able to discover their own talents, gain self-confidence, make friendships, experience the joys of learning, and grow in a holistic manner. The unique nature of each individual child is recognized. The Montessori program allows a child to develop at their own pace to reach independence, as the Educators follow the child's needs, sensitive periods and their stages of development. Observation is the key assessment tool to meet the innate qualities of children.245 Glover Ave, Lyttelton AH, Centurion, 0157, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

A foundation rooted in knowledge allows for a focussed and strong core. Through personal touch and learner support, the supportive and nurturing environment provided by Poplar Academy encourages growth and development of a confident self where knowledge shields against the challenges of the modern world. Among the core values Poplar Academy subscribes to, unconditional acceptance, recognition and development of strengths while offering support of weakness together with flexibility and leadership through guidance and service set them apart from the majority of learning institutions. Description:
Founded in 1998, Stanford Lake College is an independent English medium co-educational high school. We accept day scholars as well as weekly and termly boarders. Four hundred kilometres northeast of Johannesburg lies Magoebaskloof, picturesquely situated between Tzaneen and Polokwane, near the hamlet of Haenertsburg. THE ADVENTUROUS CHOICE We are a people of optimism, imagination and commitment. Stanford Lake College is a place of learning where acceptance and belonging prevail. We value the unique richness of every individual within the school community. At Stanford we thrive on challenges, stretching ourselves beyond the ordinary. Stanford Lake College is a "Christian ethos" school which welcomes pupils from different cultures, religions, races and languages. The school follows the Christian calendar and festivals whilst acknowledging the needs of the other religions within the Stanford community. Stanford Lake College started as a community project and is guided by the Board of Directors of the Letaba Educational Trust, which sets policies and acts as the custodian and protector of the College. Our Vision To optimise our uniqueness, and in so doing, develop balanced, globally astute individuals within the Stanford Lake College family.A22, off the, R71, Haenertsburg, 0730, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Uplands is an Anglican, co-educational Independent high school located on a picturesque, 110ha estate near White River, Mpumalanga Province, South Africa.Uplands Pre-Preparatory, Preparatory, College, Outreach.Vision and Mission Uplands VisionUplands develops interested and interesting young people who are self-confident, happy and successful in a changing world. They will be creative, critical thinkers who embrace change and develop lasting, healthy relationships.MissionWe achieve our vision by providing a dynamic, caring, well-rounded, values-based education through our quality teams at the Pre-Preparatory, Preparatory, College and Outreach. Essential to our success as we grow a world-class, forward-thinking school are the following pillars: Academics, Co-Curricular, Boarding & pastoral, Diverse community, Anglican ethos.About Our SchoolUplands strives to be Africa's pre-eminent, independent, co-educational school operating under the auspices of the Anglican Church, offering quality, holistic schooling to pupils from Grade 0000 to 12, with outstanding boarding from Grade 4 upwards. Uplands has a proven track record of success as a contemporary school with almost 100 years of timeless quality and values.Uplands delivers an engaging and globally relevant curriculum for our divers pupil body. This is achieved through a skills-based approach which promotes a culture of learning, creativitiy, critical thinking, social growth, inclusion (transformation and diversity) and talent realisation. Pupils benefit from building effective relationships with an inspired, collaborative, and innovative staff.Set in an area of extraordinary scenic beauty, Uplands is located on a spacious 110-hectare country estate in White River, Mpumalanga, South Africa. We hace exceptional facilities, in the academic, sporting, cultural and Outreach arenas. Our dynamic, caring and supportive staff provide individual attention to all pupils within a family-friendly environment, from 07h30 to 16h30 for day scholars and 24 hours for boarders, so that each pupil thrives.The full-day integrated programme us fully inclusive of required meals and tea-time snacks, sport, culture, community service sessions, supervised homework sessions and extra-curricular activities.In many ways we offer a fresh, welcoming approach. This is a culture of education that has defined who we are since our beginnings in 1928.The best way to get to know us, is to come and visit us - to see our picturesque campus and to meet some of our pupils. You are guaranteed a very warm welcome.Uplands College Honour Code       Boarding at Uplands  (see boarding video here)School is not just about teaching fractions, grammar and the impacts of soil erosion. As parents and teachers we need to ensure we are also teaching a love for resilience and grit, a drive for ingenuity and passion, and a discovery of ideas and self-discipline. We need to grow community children who are able to interact with others; those who can listen, who can lead and who can follow as the situation demands.We believe there exists in boarding the structure and environment to fully develop this very sense of character. In focussing on creating a Home-In-A-House and in searching for the Positive First, we believe our six boarding establishments continue to provide the level of care, support and challenge to develop happy, resourced and assured Uplanders. Underpinning our boarding success is an excellent team of staff that remain motivated and skilled to seek the best in your child.Sports and CultureUplands offers a wide range of sports and cultural activities including:AthleticsHockeyRugbySwimmingMTBSquashCricketNetballGymEquestrianAcademicsAcademic excellence lies at the core of the Uplands ethos. Uplands provide a challenging, relevant and balanced education for your child.Pre-Primary PhaseStarts from Grade 0000 our aim is to provide a comprehensive learning programme within a warm and loving Christian environment that caters for the 'whole child.'Foundation PhaseWe offer a structured academic programme that focuses on integrated learning in Numeracy, Literacy and Life Skills. We try to provide a varied enough curriculum to cater for the needs of children with various learning styles.Our small classes enable teachers to focus on the needs of our pupils.Senior Primary PhaseIn the Senior Primary Phase we offer a more formalised learning environment. Class teaching, combined with specialist teachers, occurs at a Grade Four and Five level. In Grades Six and Seven our pupils are exposed to subject specialist teaching. We offer a holistic curriculum covering a wide range of subjects.Have a look at our video here CollegeAcademic excellence lies at the core of the Uplands College ethos, building on the foundations laid at Uplands Preparatory School. In delivering on this goal, the College goes beyond the minimum requirements contained in the National Curriculum. We provide a challenging, relevant and balanced education that aims to cultivate the pupils' academic potential to enable them to succeed in their chosen career or profession and to lead lives of significance. Through an innovative curriculum and embracing a diverse student body, we aim to produce global citizens who are compassionate, tolerant and ethical.Uplands students write the IEB National Senior Certificate as well as other national and international benchmarking tests falling under the auspices of the IEB. To ensure consistent excellent academic delivery, Uplands runs extension and support programmes for students, professional development for staff and a mentoring programme for interns.CulturalThe Performing Arts are thriving in our beautiful environment. There is close interaction between Drama, Dance, Music and Art at all times in an effort to create broadminded, balanced young individuals. Apart from offering Drama, Music and Art as academic subjects, the College also offers extra-curricular opportunities to students interested in further developing their talents.The Visual Arts are represented in the many art exhibitions and displays around the College. Regular trips to art galleries and even a Cultural tour abroad is on offer. Extra classes and clubs form part of our after school activity list and cater for those not wanting to take it "too seriously".Drama is very much alive and well on the campus and students regularly perform to a very enthusiastic audience. Our delightful annual inter-house plays with theatrical and comic players are most entertaining. A more serious, bigger scale production is embarked upon every second year and draws support from all quarters of the school as each pupil adds his or her own particular talent to the success of the play on stage!Private music lessons including piano, clarinet, saxophone, voice, guitar and violin is given to students. The Music Departments continues to delight parents and fellow pupils with musical performances throughout the year showcasing an abundance of artistic talent.Admissions: Click here to send us an enquiry Admissions form: Download a form hereDanie Joubert Street Extension, White River, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Our Curriculum
CAPS + Project based Learning (PBL) + IEB = FUTURE-PROOF
Pre-School:
The world of the child is full of sights and sounds which at first appear chaotic. From this chaos, the child must gradually create order; they slowly gain mastery of themselves and of their environment. Dr Montessori developed the “prepared environment” which possess a certain order and disposes the child to develop his capabilities at their own speed, according to his own capacities in a non-competitive atmosphere.Our safe and effective environment helps your child develop their physical, emotional, intellectual and spiritual capacities to the fullest. To achieve this, they must have freedom.In brief, the Montessori approach is designed to help the child build within themselves the foundations for a lifetime of creative learning and expression.Our staff have Montessori and/or ECD qualifications and are registered with the South African Council for Educators (SACE).Primary – High School:
We teach the national CAPS curriculum that is integrated with Project-Based Learning from primary school level. We implement Project-Based Learning (PBL) from primary school right through to Grade 12.In Project Based Learning, the project is the vehicle for teaching the important knowledge and skills that a student needs to learn. The project contains and frames the curriculum and instruction.PBL requires critical thinking, problem-solving, collaboration, and various forms of communication. To answer a Driving Question and create high-quality work, students need to do much more than remember information. They need to use higher-order thinking skills and learn to work as a team.To help ensure our students are getting the main course and are engaging in quality Project Based Learning, We promote a research-based model for the students to learn how to question, investigate and/or design and respond to an authentic, engaging and complex question, problem and/or challenge.Our students write the Independent Examination Board (IEB) examinations in Grade 12. The IEB seeks to advance quality teaching and learning in South Africa through an assessment process of integrity, innovation and international comparability. All schools registered with the IEB to write the National Senior Certificate have access to a range of professional development opportunities as well as a variety of assessments, designed to serve a range of purposes.The IEB produces consistent, reliable results in the Grade 12 National Senior Certificate with an average pass rate between 97% and 98%. Furthermore, the IEB achieves between 78% and 80% pass with entry to degree study. Our first two cohorts of Matrics have achieved a 100% pass rate in the 2021 and 2022 IEB Matric Exams.Someday All Schools Will Teach This Way!For more and to see a virtual tour of our campus, visit https://futurenationschools.com/lyndhurst-campus/Monday7:00 am - 5:00 pmTuesdayN/AWednesdayN/AThursdayN/AFridayN/ASaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
St Mary's School, an independent Anglican School for girls, was established in 1888 and is the oldest school in Johannesburg. St Mary's caters for pupils from pre-school (Grade 000) through to matric (Grade 12). It is a school with a rich history which exudes spirit, integrity and passion. It welcomes the enrichment provided by other cultures and religions. It is an unpretentious school, which offers a real and relevant education to all in its care.Pre-primary schooling for boys and girls aged three to five begins in Grades 000 and 00 at Little Saints. Our Reggio-inspired socio-constructivist approach to pre-school education guides children to discover meaning and to encounter their world through exploration and play.Our view of the girls and boys in our care as strong and competent is informed by the emphasis Reggio places on the defence and promotion of the rights and potential of all children.The exhilarating atmosphere of Little Saints is attributable in no small part to the respect and centrality our approach gives to play, and the joyous expression it finds in creativity, communication and social interaction.For school fees and other admissions information, please contact us below by emailing or completing the form at the bottom of this page.55 Athol St, Waverley, Johannesburg, 2090, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
AcademicsCurro Salt Rock is an independent preschool in Salt Rock, Ballito, that provides high-quality early childhood development for children from 3 months to 5 years, with a focus on the ELDAs. Our small class sizes allow our dedicated teachers to engage each child in our internally developed play-based curriculum at affordable school fees and to build strong, caring relationships with each child. Our school is on the same campus as our primary and high school which allows children to easily progress from preschool to primary school in a familiar environment. What does Curro Salt Rock offer?At Curro Salt Rock, we lay the foundation for your child’s future social and academic life by incorporating play in stimulating, developmental activities such as creative movement and artistic expression. By involving you, as parents/guardians, in your child’s learning experience, we provide a holistic development programme within small class sizes at affordable school fees, that stretches beyond the classroom. How do we support your child’s early childhood development?As a Curro School, our internally developed programme is designed with the Early Learning and Development Areas (ELDAs) in mind. This approach to early childhood development aims to stimulate physical, social, emotional and cognitive well-being through developmental activities and engaging play areas. ELDAs focus on aspects such as gross-motor development, fine-motor development, social awareness, communication, spatial awareness and arts.1 New Salt Rock Drive, Salt Rock, Dolphin Coast, 4392MondayN/ATuesdayN/AWednesdayN/AThursdayN/AFridayN/ASaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Primary - High School:
We teach the national CAPS curriculum that is integrated with Project-Based Learning from primary school level. We implement Project-Based Learning (PBL) from primary school right through to Grade 12.In Project Based Learning, the project is the vehicle for teaching the important knowledge and skills that a student needs to learn. The project contains and frames the curriculum and instruction.PBL requires critical thinking, problem-solving, collaboration, and various forms of communication. To answer a Driving Question and create high-quality work, students need to do much more than remember information. They need to use higher-order thinking skills and learn to work as a team.To help ensure our students are getting the main course and are engaging in quality Project Based Learning, We promote a research-based model for the students to learn how to question, investigate and/or design and respond to an authentic, engaging and complex question, problem and/or challenge.Our students write the Independent Examination Board (IEB) examinations in Grade 12. The IEB seeks to advance quality teaching and learning in South Africa through an assessment process of integrity, innovation and international comparability. Description:
Curro Bloemfontein is an independent school in Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, that provides high-quality education to learners from 4 years to Grade 7. With small class sizes, dedicated teachers, an enhanced curriculum and a strong focus on STEAMD and Robotics, we empower learners with 21st-century skills and knowledge to grow into high-performing, self-confident individuals, ready to become the leaders of the future. Foundation phase: 4 years to Grade 3Our foundation phase starts by providing the emotional and intellectual foundation required to handle the formal learning that starts in Grade 1. We then gradually develop learners' skills and knowledge in basic areas such as language (comprehension, speaking and listening), mathematics (counting and understanding numbers) and creative problem-solving, in an environment in which they enjoy being. Through our enhanced curriculum, learners are introduced to project-based learning and gain 21st-century skills through subjects such as Robotics (from Grade R), and with Sesotho and Afrikaans as additional language options.Intermediate phase: Grade 4 to Grade 7In these grades, learners are led into more abstract thought and independent work. Our small class sizes and dedicated teachers prepare them for high school by teaching them how to apply the 21st-century skills and concepts they have learned. As a Curro School, we also promote creativity and critical thinking by encouraging children to make their own choices within well-established boundaries. Our enhanced curriculum includes specialised subjects such as Information Technology and Robotics. Learners in this phase may use tablets in class to enhance their learning experience, and learners have the choice between Afrikaans or Sesotho as an additional language.Curro Bloemfontein activitiesWe believe that participation in sports and cultural activities plays an important role in developing a well-rounded learner and promoting friendship, team-awareness and self-confidence. Therefore, our wide range of activities is designed to help learners discover their inherent talents, or broaden their exposure beyond their current reference framework. Our extramural activities are offered by private tutors or coaches, at an additional cost. Some of these activities are aimed at boosting learners' cognitive abilities while others provide pure enjoyment. Academics - High SchoolCurro Bloemfontein is an independent high school in Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, that provides high-quality education for learners from Grade 8 to Grade 12. Our dedicated teachers and well-rounded approach prepare learners for the IEB examinations at the end of Grade 12. With small class sizes, dedicated teachers and an enhanced curriculum focusing on STEAMD, we empower learners with 21st-century skills and knowledge to grow into high-performing, self-confident individuals, ready to become the leaders of the future.Senior phase: Grade 8 and Grade 9In these grades, we guide learners to adjust to a greater workload of higher intensity. With dedicated teachers and affordable school fees, our enhanced approach places great emphasis on problem solving and individual thinking. Teaching in our small class sizes takes place in English, and learners gain 21st-century skills in all subjects, including Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD).FET phase: Grade 10 to Grade 12This phase prepares learners for the IEB examinations written at the end of Grade 12. However, we emphasise a greater world-readiness rather than a purely examinations-driven approach. Our learners are taught to think innovatively, express their ideas and take charge of their own lives - all highly-valued 21st-century skills. Furthermore, as a Curro School, 21st-century learning is implemented in all subjects, including specialised subjects such as Information Technology and Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD). Our learners also use e-books in class rather than textbooks for certain subjects.We use e-books in classAs a Curro School, our high-school learners use personal computers or e-books in class rather than textbooks. Printed textbooks may be purchased at an additional cost. By exposing learners in our small class sizes to the daily use of technology, they are better prepared for the challenges of tertiary studies, as well as the ever-changing workplace of the future.Our matric learners write the IEB examinationsThe Independent Examinations Board (IEB) is an independent assessment board. Accredited by Umalusi, the board provides assessments in which the question style is deemed more challenging and comprehensive than it is in the National Senior Certificate final assessments. The final examinations set by the IEB are esteemed both locally and abroad, and prepare learners for the intense increase in workload during tertiary studies.Admissions Enquiries HereCurro Crescent, Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, 9301, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
St Martin's School traces its origins back to the foundation of St Agnes School for the training of domestic helpers in 1908. A few years later in 1911, St Peter's Priory and College were added, offering a boarding-based high school education to the young men who came from the length and breadth of South Africa. It soon became known as the "Black Eton" where academic achievements were espoused. The list of the early alumni is impressive, the likes of Oliver Tambo, Fikile Bam and Hugh Masekela, as well as many of our former students, hold key positions in government and in large international corporations. The apartheid policies of the National Party regime put pressure on the school and it was closed in 1956. However, the Anglican Church ensured that education continued in this attractive part of southern Johannesburg. The buildings reopened for business in 1958 when St Martin's School was born. High School In line with the requirements of the new curriculum, the High School has moved away from the traditional model of educators dispensing knowledge to passive and obedient students.4 East Road, the Hill, Johannesburg South, 2190, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:30 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:30 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:30 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:30 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:30 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Uplands is an Anglican, co-educational Independent high school located on a picturesque, 110ha estate near White River, Mpumalanga Province, South Africa.Uplands Pre-Preparatory, Preparatory, College, Outreach.Vision and Mission Uplands VisionUplands develops interested and interesting young people who are self-confident, happy and successful in a changing world. They will be creative, critical thinkers who embrace change and develop lasting, healthy relationships.MissionWe achieve our vision by providing a dynamic, caring, well-rounded, values-based education through our quality teams at the Pre-Preparatory, Preparatory, College and Outreach. Essential to our success as we grow a world-class, forward-thinking school are the following pillars: Academics, Co-Curricular, Boarding & pastoral, Diverse community, Anglican ethos.About Our SchoolUplands strives to be Africa's pre-eminent, independent, co-educational school operating under the auspices of the Anglican Church, offering quality, holistic schooling to pupils from Grade 0000 to 12, with outstanding boarding from Grade 4 upwards. Uplands has a proven track record of success as a contemporary school with almost 100 years of timeless quality and values.Uplands delivers an engaging and globally relevant curriculum for our divers pupil body. This is achieved through a skills-based approach which promotes a culture of learning, creativitiy, critical thinking, social growth, inclusion (transformation and diversity) and talent realisation. Pupils benefit from building effective relationships with an inspired, collaborative, and innovative staff.Set in an area of extraordinary scenic beauty, Uplands is located on a spacious 110-hectare country estate in White River, Mpumalanga, South Africa. We hace exceptional facilities, in the academic, sporting, cultural and Outreach arenas. Our dynamic, caring and supportive staff provide individual attention to all pupils within a family-friendly environment, from 07h30 to 16h30 for day scholars and 24 hours for boarders, so that each pupil thrives.The full-day integrated programme us fully inclusive of required meals and tea-time snacks, sport, culture, community service sessions, supervised homework sessions and extra-curricular activities.In many ways we offer a fresh, welcoming approach. This is a culture of education that has defined who we are since our beginnings in 1928.The best way to get to know us, is to come and visit us - to see our picturesque campus and to meet some of our pupils. You are guaranteed a very warm welcome.Uplands College Honour Code       Boarding at Uplands  (see boarding video here)School is not just about teaching fractions, grammar and the impacts of soil erosion. As parents and teachers we need to ensure we are also teaching a love for resilience and grit, a drive for ingenuity and passion, and a discovery of ideas and self-discipline. We need to grow community children who are able to interact with others; those who can listen, who can lead and who can follow as the situation demands.We believe there exists in boarding the structure and environment to fully develop this very sense of character. In focussing on creating a Home-In-A-House and in searching for the Positive First, we believe our six boarding establishments continue to provide the level of care, support and challenge to develop happy, resourced and assured Uplanders. Underpinning our boarding success is an excellent team of staff that remain motivated and skilled to seek the best in your child.Sports and CultureUplands offers a wide range of sports and cultural activities including:AthleticsHockeyRugbySwimmingMTBSquashCricketNetballGymEquestrianAcademicsAcademic excellence lies at the core of the Uplands ethos. Uplands provide a challenging, relevant and balanced education for your child.Pre-Primary PhaseStarts from Grade 0000 our aim is to provide a comprehensive learning programme within a warm and loving Christian environment that caters for the 'whole child.'Foundation PhaseWe offer a structured academic programme that focuses on integrated learning in Numeracy, Literacy and Life Skills. We try to provide a varied enough curriculum to cater for the needs of children with various learning styles.Our small classes enable teachers to focus on the needs of our pupils.Senior Primary PhaseIn the Senior Primary Phase we offer a more formalised learning environment. Class teaching, combined with specialist teachers, occurs at a Grade Four and Five level. In Grades Six and Seven our pupils are exposed to subject specialist teaching. We offer a holistic curriculum covering a wide range of subjects.Have a look at our video here CollegeAcademic excellence lies at the core of the Uplands College ethos, building on the foundations laid at Uplands Preparatory School. In delivering on this goal, the College goes beyond the minimum requirements contained in the National Curriculum. We provide a challenging, relevant and balanced education that aims to cultivate the pupils' academic potential to enable them to succeed in their chosen career or profession and to lead lives of significance. Through an innovative curriculum and embracing a diverse student body, we aim to produce global citizens who are compassionate, tolerant and ethical.Uplands students write the IEB National Senior Certificate as well as other national and international benchmarking tests falling under the auspices of the IEB. To ensure consistent excellent academic delivery, Uplands runs extension and support programmes for students, professional development for staff and a mentoring programme for interns.CulturalThe Performing Arts are thriving in our beautiful environment. There is close interaction between Drama, Dance, Music and Art at all times in an effort to create broadminded, balanced young individuals. Apart from offering Drama, Music and Art as academic subjects, the College also offers extra-curricular opportunities to students interested in further developing their talents.The Visual Arts are represented in the many art exhibitions and displays around the College. Regular trips to art galleries and even a Cultural tour abroad is on offer. Extra classes and clubs form part of our after school activity list and cater for those not wanting to take it "too seriously".Drama is very much alive and well on the campus and students regularly perform to a very enthusiastic audience. Our delightful annual inter-house plays with theatrical and comic players are most entertaining. A more serious, bigger scale production is embarked upon every second year and draws support from all quarters of the school as each pupil adds his or her own particular talent to the success of the play on stage!Private music lessons including piano, clarinet, saxophone, voice, guitar and violin is given to students. The Music Departments continues to delight parents and fellow pupils with musical performances throughout the year showcasing an abundance of artistic talent.Admissions: Click here to send us an enquiry Admissions form: Download a form hereDanie Joubert Street Extension, White River, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
In May 2024 Little Star Educare Centre has been faithfully serving the community of Amanzimtoti for 29 years! The ethos of Little Star is always to create a loving, stimulating and safe environment for all children.Visitors are welcome at any time - just drop in. If you want to see the principal, feel free to make an appointment.OPENING AND CLOSING TIMESLittle Star opens at 07:00 and closes at 17:30 sharp. There is also an Earlybird service from 06:30 and a nap time service for half-day up to 14:30. Little Star is open during the school holidays. We close for public holidays and for three weeks over the Christmas period.EXTRAMURAL ACTIVITIESLittle Star offers a variety of extramural activities which are outsourced to vetted providers. Fees for extramural activities are paid separately from school fees.MEALSThe children are well-fed at Little Star! They get breakfast, a mid-morning snack, lunch and an afternoon snack. The tuck shop is open once a week. During the holiday periods, when the attendance is lower, picnics, braais and outings are organised.DAILY DIARYEach class follows a daily programme the details of which can be found displayed in the classroom.Breakfast is served at 08:00 If you wish your child to eat breakfast please ensure that they arrive before 08:15. Breakfast cannot be served to latecomers.Lessons start at 08:30 Snack time is at 10:00 The children are then free to play in the garden. Lessons start again at 11:00Red Group is served lunch at 11:45 Blue Group at 11:50 and Grade R at 12:00 Nap time follows lunch until 14:00. Afternoon snack time is at 15:00.THE GROUNDSLittle Star Educare Centre is situated at 24 Riverside Road, Amanzimtoti, behind the Catholic church. There are two gardens: a big spacious garden that is equipped with a large jungle gym, swings and a sand pit, and a smaller garden that has a variety of playground equipment.Click here to email an enquiryLittle Star Educare Centre, 24 Riverside Road, Amanzimtoti, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 5:30 pmTuesday7:00 am - 5:30 pmWednesday7:00 am - 5:30 pmThursday7:00 am - 5:30 pmFriday7:00 am - 5:30 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
St Martin's School traces its origins back to the foundation of St Agnes School for the training of domestic helpers in 1908. A few years later in 1911, St Peter's Priory and College were added, offering a boarding-based high school education to the young men who came from the length and breadth of South Africa. It soon became known as the "Black Eton" where academic achievements were espoused. The list of the early alumni is impressive, the likes of Oliver Tambo, Fikile Bam and Hugh Masekela, as well as many of our former students, hold key positions in government and in large international corporations. The apartheid policies of the National Party regime put pressure on the school and it was closed in 1956. However, the Anglican Church ensured that education continued in this attractive part of southern Johannesburg. The buildings reopened for business in 1958 when St Martin's School was born. High School In line with the requirements of the new curriculum, the High School has moved away from the traditional model of educators dispensing knowledge to passive and obedient students.4 East Road, the Hill, Johannesburg South, 2190, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
We follow the Reggio Emilia-inspired approach which values the child as strong, capable, resilient and rich with wonder and knowledge. Our flexible learning spaces are filled with natural light and glass with an indoor exploratory learning hub. Technology Hub The Reggio Emilia-inspired approach in the Pre-Prep de-emphasises the utilisation of technology in this phase although our portable bank of iPads is frequently used for the documentation of our children's progress. However, the fundamentals of coding are formally introduced in our Grade 0 learning communities as detailed below. Robotics in the Pre-Preparatory phase is a 'hands on' approach to learning, where students build and design simple mechanisms from their environment whilst 'learning through play' with Lego Simple Machines. Whilst building activities range from spinning tops to racing cars, skills learnt involve an integration of Mathematics, Science and Linguistics. Coding skills are promoted through the use of the Sphero Bolt - a robotic ball that can be programmed to manoeuvre through specific paths, whilst displaying colour and sound effects.Rallim Preparatory | Cape Town, Deerhurst Drive, Sunningdale, Cape Town, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Foundation phase: Grade R to Grade 3With dedicated teachers and small class sizes, our foundation phase starts by providing the emotional and intellectual foundation required to handle the formal learning that starts in Grade 1. Through our enhanced curriculum we then gradually develop learners’ 21st-century skills and knowledge in basic areas such as language (comprehension, speaking and listening), mathematics (counting and understanding numbers), and creative problem-solving in an environment where they enjoy coming to school. As a Curro School, learners even benefit from being introduced to Robotics through Duplo Lego. Teaching takes place in English or Afrikaans, but isiZulu is offered as a conversational language from Grade 1. Intermediate phase: Grade 4 to Grade 7In these grades, learners are taught to work with the learned material in an abstract manner. The nature of the content gradually builds from being tangible and real to more intellectual and abstract. Our small class sizes and enhanced curriculum provide learners with an inherent dedication to hard work and excellence as well as 21st-century skills through specialised subjects such as Natural Sciences (with Robotics) and Technology (Grade 7).1 New Salt Rock Drive, Salt Rock, Dolphin Coast, 4392MondayN/ATuesdayN/AWednesdayN/AThursdayN/AFridayN/ASaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
St Teresa's School started in 1930 when three Sisters of Mercy welcomed their first five pupils to a garage in Keyes Avenue, Rosebank. There was no government support of any kind for Catholic Schools so, of necessity, the school was private. With careful management and through the support of parents, the school was financially viable and was gradually able to extend its facilities along Keyes Ave to meet new needs. It was one of the first schools in the country to defy Apartheid laws and admit pupils of all races.The school has undergone various name changes from Rosebank Convent to St Teresa's Convent and finally today all three sections of the school are under one umbrella called St Teresa's School. The school caters for Grade 000 â€“ Grade 12. The Junior Primary is situated just down the road in Craighall Park, while the Senior Primary and the High School share the lovely grounds in Keyes Ave, the very street where the five pupils were taught over 92 years ago. While we have kept pace with the changes and challenges of our society, we have maintained the traditional values of service, faith, integrity, compassion and personal excellence. This spirituality expresses itself in service to others, especially those on the fringes of society.The professional staff are all qualified and compassionate members of staff. The school is managed by the Sisters of Mercy, the Board of Governors and the School Management Team. The school constantly achieves well academically and is in the top bracket of schools in the Gauteng Province. The school is a member of ISASA. Matrics write the IEB Senior Examination.Today, 90 years on, St Teresa's School is a much respected private school, proud of its unique tradition, its successes measured by the outstanding girls who have passed through its portals. Every girl who has been a member of our school is known as a Rosie and is a part of the Rosie Family for life.Our VisionRooted in Christ's teaching of love for God, self and others, the family of St Teresa's School is committed to developing the values of compassion, service, love and respect in our girls. We aim to nurture and inspire responsible, enquiring young women who strive for excellence in all facets of life.18 Keyes Ave, Rosebank, Johannesburg, 2196, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Curro Bloemfontein is an independent school in Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, that provides high-quality education to learners from 4 years to Grade 7. With small class sizes, dedicated teachers, an enhanced curriculum and a strong focus on STEAMD and Robotics, we empower learners with 21st-century skills and knowledge to grow into high-performing, self-confident individuals, ready to become the leaders of the future. Foundation phase: 4 years to Grade 3Our foundation phase starts by providing the emotional and intellectual foundation required to handle the formal learning that starts in Grade 1. We then gradually develop learners' skills and knowledge in basic areas such as language (comprehension, speaking and listening), mathematics (counting and understanding numbers) and creative problem-solving, in an environment in which they enjoy being. Through our enhanced curriculum, learners are introduced to project-based learning and gain 21st-century skills through subjects such as Robotics (from Grade R), and with Sesotho and Afrikaans as additional language options.Intermediate phase: Grade 4 to Grade 7In these grades, learners are led into more abstract thought and independent work. Our small class sizes and dedicated teachers prepare them for high school by teaching them how to apply the 21st-century skills and concepts they have learned. As a Curro School, we also promote creativity and critical thinking by encouraging children to make their own choices within well-established boundaries. Our enhanced curriculum includes specialised subjects such as Information Technology and Robotics. Learners in this phase may use tablets in class to enhance their learning experience, and learners have the choice between Afrikaans or Sesotho as an additional language.Curro Bloemfontein activitiesWe believe that participation in sports and cultural activities plays an important role in developing a well-rounded learner and promoting friendship, team-awareness and self-confidence. Therefore, our wide range of activities is designed to help learners discover their inherent talents, or broaden their exposure beyond their current reference framework. Our extramural activities are offered by private tutors or coaches, at an additional cost. Some of these activities are aimed at boosting learners' cognitive abilities while others provide pure enjoyment. Academics - High SchoolCurro Bloemfontein is an independent high school in Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, that provides high-quality education for learners from Grade 8 to Grade 12. Our dedicated teachers and well-rounded approach prepare learners for the IEB examinations at the end of Grade 12. With small class sizes, dedicated teachers and an enhanced curriculum focusing on STEAMD, we empower learners with 21st-century skills and knowledge to grow into high-performing, self-confident individuals, ready to become the leaders of the future.Senior phase: Grade 8 and Grade 9In these grades, we guide learners to adjust to a greater workload of higher intensity. With dedicated teachers and affordable school fees, our enhanced approach places great emphasis on problem solving and individual thinking. Teaching in our small class sizes takes place in English, and learners gain 21st-century skills in all subjects, including Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD).FET phase: Grade 10 to Grade 12This phase prepares learners for the IEB examinations written at the end of Grade 12. However, we emphasise a greater world-readiness rather than a purely examinations-driven approach. Our learners are taught to think innovatively, express their ideas and take charge of their own lives - all highly-valued 21st-century skills. Furthermore, as a Curro School, 21st-century learning is implemented in all subjects, including specialised subjects such as Information Technology and Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD). Our learners also use e-books in class rather than textbooks for certain subjects.We use e-books in classAs a Curro School, our high-school learners use personal computers or e-books in class rather than textbooks. Printed textbooks may be purchased at an additional cost. By exposing learners in our small class sizes to the daily use of technology, they are better prepared for the challenges of tertiary studies, as well as the ever-changing workplace of the future.Our matric learners write the IEB examinationsThe Independent Examinations Board (IEB) is an independent assessment board. Accredited by Umalusi, the board provides assessments in which the question style is deemed more challenging and comprehensive than it is in the National Senior Certificate final assessments. The final examinations set by the IEB are esteemed both locally and abroad, and prepare learners for the intense increase in workload during tertiary studies.Admissions Enquiries HereCurro Crescent, Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, 9301, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
St Mary's School, an independent Anglican School for girls, was established in 1888 and is the oldest school in Johannesburg. St Mary's caters for pupils from pre-school (Grade 000) through to matric (Grade 12). It is a school with a rich history which exudes spirit, integrity and passion. It welcomes the enrichment provided by other cultures and religions. It is an unpretentious school, which offers a real and relevant education to all in its care.Throughout St Mary's 136-year history, it has endeavoured to make a difference in the community and add value to the lives of its pupils while, at the same time, maintaining standards of excellence in every sphere. St Mary's believes in sharing its privilege because that is the very essence of being an Anglican school.Proud to embrace its history, the school is also committed to providing a dynamic, relevant education for each girl in the 21st century. The students are then ready to go out into the world knowing that, as women, they can do anything to which they set their mindsThe school offers a challenging curriculum with a wide range of subjects. The intranet, a wireless campus and interactive whiteboards in most classrooms ensure that the school is up-to-date with technology.Since the Independent Education Board's inception, St Mary's has enjoyed a 100% matriculation pass rate.For school fees and other admissions information, please contact us below by emailing or completing the form at the bottom of this page.55 Athol St, Waverley, Johannesburg, 2090, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Curro Bloemfontein is an independent school in Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, that provides high-quality education to learners from 4 years to Grade 7. With small class sizes, dedicated teachers, an enhanced curriculum and a strong focus on STEAMD and Robotics, we empower learners with 21st-century skills and knowledge to grow into high-performing, self-confident individuals, ready to become the leaders of the future. Foundation phase: 4 years to Grade 3Our foundation phase starts by providing the emotional and intellectual foundation required to handle the formal learning that starts in Grade 1. We then gradually develop learners' skills and knowledge in basic areas such as language (comprehension, speaking and listening), mathematics (counting and understanding numbers) and creative problem-solving, in an environment in which they enjoy being. Through our enhanced curriculum, learners are introduced to project-based learning and gain 21st-century skills through subjects such as Robotics (from Grade R), and with Sesotho and Afrikaans as additional language options.Intermediate phase: Grade 4 to Grade 7In these grades, learners are led into more abstract thought and independent work. Our small class sizes and dedicated teachers prepare them for high school by teaching them how to apply the 21st-century skills and concepts they have learned. As a Curro School, we also promote creativity and critical thinking by encouraging children to make their own choices within well-established boundaries. Our enhanced curriculum includes specialised subjects such as Information Technology and Robotics. Learners in this phase may use tablets in class to enhance their learning experience, and learners have the choice between Afrikaans or Sesotho as an additional language.Curro Bloemfontein activitiesWe believe that participation in sports and cultural activities plays an important role in developing a well-rounded learner and promoting friendship, team-awareness and self-confidence. Therefore, our wide range of activities is designed to help learners discover their inherent talents, or broaden their exposure beyond their current reference framework. Our extramural activities are offered by private tutors or coaches, at an additional cost. Some of these activities are aimed at boosting learners' cognitive abilities while others provide pure enjoyment. Academics - High SchoolCurro Bloemfontein is an independent high school in Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, that provides high-quality education for learners from Grade 8 to Grade 12. Our dedicated teachers and well-rounded approach prepare learners for the IEB examinations at the end of Grade 12. With small class sizes, dedicated teachers and an enhanced curriculum focusing on STEAMD, we empower learners with 21st-century skills and knowledge to grow into high-performing, self-confident individuals, ready to become the leaders of the future.Senior phase: Grade 8 and Grade 9In these grades, we guide learners to adjust to a greater workload of higher intensity. With dedicated teachers and affordable school fees, our enhanced approach places great emphasis on problem solving and individual thinking. Teaching in our small class sizes takes place in English, and learners gain 21st-century skills in all subjects, including Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD).FET phase: Grade 10 to Grade 12This phase prepares learners for the IEB examinations written at the end of Grade 12. However, we emphasise a greater world-readiness rather than a purely examinations-driven approach. Our learners are taught to think innovatively, express their ideas and take charge of their own lives - all highly-valued 21st-century skills. Furthermore, as a Curro School, 21st-century learning is implemented in all subjects, including specialised subjects such as Information Technology and Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD). Our learners also use e-books in class rather than textbooks for certain subjects.We use e-books in classAs a Curro School, our high-school learners use personal computers or e-books in class rather than textbooks. Printed textbooks may be purchased at an additional cost. By exposing learners in our small class sizes to the daily use of technology, they are better prepared for the challenges of tertiary studies, as well as the ever-changing workplace of the future.Our matric learners write the IEB examinationsThe Independent Examinations Board (IEB) is an independent assessment board. Accredited by Umalusi, the board provides assessments in which the question style is deemed more challenging and comprehensive than it is in the National Senior Certificate final assessments. The final examinations set by the IEB are esteemed both locally and abroad, and prepare learners for the intense increase in workload during tertiary studies.Admissions Enquiries HereCurro Crescent, Groenvlei, Bloemfontein, 9301, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
The Vine School offers a classic Ambleside curriculum, applying Charlotte Mason’s philosophy of education. In small classes of 16 children, teachers know each child personally. Their natural curiosity is engaged through “living books”, nature walks and great art & music. Classrooms are peaceful, attractive spaces where children are loved, accepted and supported in a non-competitive atmosphere. Teachers diligently train them to pay attention, take turns, listen to others, speak truthfully and practice self-control – all of which leads to success in learning. As a result, our children love to learn!The Vine School helps develop the minds and hearts of children in an atmosphere of joy where great ideas are pursued, so they can grow into adults prepared for a changeable future filled with work opportunities which haven’t even been thought of yet.Christian teachers provide outstanding education, inspiring children to think creatively and love learning, in an atmosphere of joyful discovery, using the Ambleside teaching method.37 Denver Rd, Lansdowne, Cape Town, 7780, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesdayN/AWednesdayN/AThursdayN/AFridayN/ASaturdayN/ASundayN/A

Description:
Mathews Phosa High School is aptly situated in the quiet and peaceful surroundings on an estate 60 km west of Nelspruit in Mpumalanga and within three hours drive from the Gauteng Province Johannesburg and Pretoria. The mountains, trees, birds and animals are a new experience to the dwellers of Mpumalanga Nelspruit; an escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The natural surroundings and seclusions of the school make it the most conducive environment for learning. Non-Exclusive Independent School To accommodate the school's mission, a Section 21 Company (non-profit making and independent) secondary school was instituted. The school is registered as Mathews Phosa College with the local provincial Education Department for the purpose of accreditation and examination. All funding would come from school and hostel fees paid by parents. In order not to be exclusive the fees would be kept as low as possible to afford students of limited financial means the opportunity to also attend. Our academic program is challenging and varied while we offer an innovative yet rigorous academic environment that demands of each individual that they do their best in order to leave school with the best possible marks and skilled for Life.Mathews Phosa college, Weltevreden road, Schoemanskloof, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
The privilege of parenthood brings with it the responsibility of planning for the future of our children. Difficult decisions must often be made, with the only guideline being the fact that whatever choices we make, our children deserve only the best. At home, we ensure that the values we instil equip them for the future. It is, however, the time they spend with others - educators and friends that concern us most, for they are beyond our control.This is why the choice of a place or learning is possibly the most important decision any parent can make, as this decision will ultimately affect a Iearner's ability to succeed in life. At Parklands College, we offer complete peace of mind, not only preparing the child academically but also emotionally, socially, morally and physically, in preparation for life's challenges."Reaching Outwards, Growing Minds, Building Futures"CHRISTOPHER ROBIN PRE-PRIMARY AND CRACKERJACKSGrades 0000 - R (12 months - 6 years)Christopher Robin Pre-Primary School was established in 1980 as a progressive and dynamic place of learning. It offers a nurturing, positive environment where children have a sense of belonging. Our pre-primary provides a safe and emotionally secure setting that encourages the development of the whole child: emotionally, socially, physically, and intellectually. With lots of time for uninterrupted, child-directed play, this is an opportunity for them to interact socially and engage with their friends. Exploration of a wide variety of equipment available for the children promotes healthy, physical bodies, developing flexibility, endurance, and strength. Playtime is also an important opportunity for children to become independent, develop confidence, and demonstrate creativity. We know that children begin to learn as soon as they are born, and that in the early years the foundation is laid for a child's future development and success. Building a child's physical, language, and social skills prepares him or her for the academic, cultural, and sporting opportunities offered in primary school. At Christopher Robin Pre-Primary we approach these goals with passion, care and commitment.PREPARATORYGrades 1-6We believe that effective teaching involves passion, knowledge, skill, discipline, motivation and care. Our educators foster high expectations of the learners and rigorously continue to promote the culture of excellence that pervades the very essence of our school. Our vision is one in which the holistic education of the individual goes beyond academic excellence. A healthy balance exists between the different spheres in our school whereby emphasis is placed on achievement on an individual and a collective level. This is achieved by the growth of self-esteem and the realisation of each individual's potential. We believe that innovative approaches and pioneering methods along with the acquisition of certain fundamental skills are necessary for the success of a school thereby ensuring that Parklands College continues to remain a forerunner in educational innovation.SECONDARYGrades 7-12The Secondary Faculty provides a distinctive academic experience for our learners. The academic programme gives each learner a firm grasp of fundamental skills, the ability to think critically, innovatively, and independently, and fosters a love of learning. Educators create learning activities that are motivational, technology-rich, and aligned to the needs of 21st century learners. Our educators offer a challenging and stimulating education in an achievement-focused culture. They are knowledgeable, enthusiastic and have high expectations of their learners. Each individual learner is valued, and student progress is closely monitored. The educators provide exceptional academic support, within the regular instructional programme and through additional tutorials that provide personalised learning support.The Secondary Faculty follows the national curriculum, with a wide spectrum of courses leading to the National Senior Certificate. We endeavour to ensure that the choice of subjects offered is as wide as possible, providing for the needs of each learner. It is this breadth and variety, along with an opportunity to pursue subjects of choice, which encourages our children to become life-long learners, seeing knowledge as intrinsically worthwhile. In addition to the required subjects, a number of enrichment subjects are offered, providing learners with a varied educational experience that satisfies individual interests.INFORMATION TECHNOLOGYParklands College has been recognised by Apple as an Apple Distinguished School (ADS) for its innovation, leadership and educational excellence. As an Apple Distinguished and Google Apps for Education school, we use both platforms to provide a unique teaching and learning experience. Learners are introduced to iPads in Grade R, progressing to the Apple 1:1 environment beginning in Grade 1 and continuing through to Grade 12. Each child's device becomes a personalised learning platform where its integration into learning and life becomes second nature. Throughout the College, learners engage in a variety of technology enriched activities through which they learn new concepts, practise and consolidate existing skills, create unique products, explore new ideas and pursue curiosities, engage in remediation and participate in enrichment.At Parklands College, educational technology and a high-tech collaborative environment has allowed our teachers to extend their lessons in innovative ways and encourage learners to develop global competencies by solving real world problems. Our teaching staff includes Apple and Google certified educators who share their expertise with colleagues, as well as teachers at other schools both locally and abroad.Programming is an essential digital literacy of the future, and design an essential skill. For this reason Robotics and Programming is a compulsory subject from Grade 1 to 8. This subject fosters an interest in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics, and develops higher order thinking skills such as creativity and problem solving in our learners, through the building and programming of robots. Our Grade 9 learners all receive computer programming and computer design training, enabling those wishing to take Information Technology to make an informed subject choice in Grade 10.We promote invention through the use of AutoCAD and 3D printers in Drawing Technology, Engineering and Graphics Design, and Design where our learner make their thinking visible by creating 3D printed products.Film, Animation, Sound Engineering and Mobile Application Development extension courses are on offer during the school day in our state-of-the-art media studios and coding incubator. Our learners have released a digital album called "Origin" on iTunes as well as two free educational applications, "Simple Learning Time" and "Simple Learning Afrikaans", available on the Apple App Store.Our internationally recognised offerings include CompTIA certifications, AUTOCAD, Adobe Photoshop Visual Communication certification (ACA) and the ICDL WebEditing certification.Parklands College continues to explore new and emerging technologies in order to keep abreast of world trends in education.50 Wood Dr, Parklands, Cape Town, 7441Monday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Situated in the quiet suburbs of Rustenburg, Selly Park Convent Primary School is an English medium, co-educational day school catering for learners from Grade RR to Grade 7.The school accepts learners from the Catholic faith, as well as the wider community. Students participate in all aspects of school life: academic, cultural, religious, social and sport. Acceptance pre-supposes having received and signed the School Rules, Contract of Payment and Parent/Guardian Declaration. A detailed Policy for Admission of Learners is available upon request. Emphasis is placed on the holistic education of the child, and the relationship between school and home is a vital one.2021 PMR Golden Arrow Award - Category, Best Private School in the North West.Selly Park Convent Primary is an English medium school and all students and staff are expected to communicate in English whilst at school. The school follows the National Curriculum and also offers additional subjects such as Religious Education, Technology, Robotics and Coding, Physical Education and Swimming. The school strives to maintain a cutting-edge approach to both curriculum and content, and ensures the various IEB benchmarking tests are carried out each year. (Grade 3 International Benchmarking Tests for Mathematics, English and Science - Grade 6 Core Skills Test - Grade 7 MATCH Test). The school also offers a wide range of extra-curricular activities. MISSION STATEMENTCURRENT STATUSSelly Park Convent Primary School is a registered Public Benefit Organisation (PBO Registration number 18/11/13/2057). This means that, as we are registered with the South African Revenue Service, all donations to the school are tax deductible in the hands of donors. The school is registered with the Department of Education (EMIS No. 101952). Selly Park Convent Primary School has received full accreditation from UMALUSI, the Council appointed by government to maintain quality assurance in education. Selly Park Convent Primary School  is also registered with the IEB (Independent Examinations Board) as part of their Primary School Initiative.Bishop Kevin Dowling is the representative of the Catholic School's Trust on the Board of Governors. Mr. Richard Pilkington, a Trust appointee, is the Chairperson of the Board of Governors. The Board is comprised of Catholic Schools Trust, parent, teacher and community representatives. Mrs. Louise Connellan was appointed Principal of Selly Park Convent Primary School in January 2021 after serving as Deputy Principal for thirteen years.The school accepts learners from the Catholic faith, as well as the wider community. Students participate in all aspects of school life: academic, cultural, religious, social and sport. Acceptance pre-supposes having received and signed the School Rules, Contract of Payment and Parent/Guardian Declaration. A detailed Policy for Admission of Learners is available upon request. Emphasis is placed on the holistic education of the child, and the relationship between school and home is a vital one.Selly Park Convent Primary is an English medium school and all students and staff are expected to communicate in English whilst at school. The school follows the National Curriculum and also offers additional subjects such as Religious Education, Technology, Robotics and Coding, Physical Education and Swimming. The school strives to maintain a cutting-edge approach to both curriculum and content, and ensures the various IEB benchmarking tests are carried out each year. (Grade 3 International Benchmarking Tests for Mathematics, English and Science - Grade 6 Core Skills Test - Grade 7 MATCH Test). The school also offers a wide range of extra-curricular activities.Information on current school fees is available in the application form which provides the Financial Policy for the School.We look forward to welcoming your child into our School Community and trust that our relationship will be a long and happy one.Drakensberg Road, Rustenburg, North West 0323, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
The primary goal of a Montessori program is to help each child reach its full potential in all areas of life. The method of Montessori is based on three key factors; the specialized training of the teacher, a specially prepared environment complete with Montessori apparatus and a multi age grouping of children. When these elements are in place, young children are able to discover their own talents, gain self-confidence, make friendships, experience the joys of learning, and grow in a holistic manner. The unique nature of each individual child is recognized. The Montessori program allows a child to develop at their own pace to reach independence, as the Educators follow the child's needs, sensitive periods and their stages of development. Observation is the key assessment tool to meet the innate qualities of children.245 Glover Ave, Lyttelton AH, Centurion, 0157, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Insight Learning Centre is a Private Christian School, catering for Grade R to Grade 12.The school accommodates all learners, may they be gifted-, average-or slow learners.Insight Learning Centre is open for admission to learners of any race, colour or creed. Classes are kept small, giving individual attention to learners. Insight Learning Centre also specializes in teaching methods to assist learners in the normal class, as well as in Remedial teaching and in special classes.The school operates in co-operation with doctors, specialists and therapists to assist learners in different fields.The school maintains an excellent pass rate.ABOUTDebbie Kellerman started the school in 2001 for her own child. Since then the school has expanded to both Primary and High School.Insight Learning Centre is a private educational facility funded by school fees and private investors. Insight Learning Centre is registered as an examination centre with the Department of Education. Insight Learning Centre strives to fill the gaps in the present education system by deviating from the norm in the following manner:"We limit the number of learners per class to an average of 16, thereby ensuring maximum and personal attention".
"We create a stimulating environment conducive to the effective transferral of information".
"We create an organized, disciplined and safe environment for all learners".
"We create a loving and caring environment in the classroom". Mission
Our mission is to create a community of empowered learners in an atmosphere of mutual respect and trust. Every learner will be inspired and challenged to learn, grow, and accomplish academic, social and vocational goals. Description:

Description:
This is an extraordinary school; one that provides both teachers and learners the opportunity to realise their enormous potential. What makes Lebone II so unique is that it is the creation of the king, and is thus an important part of the Royal Bafokeng Nation. As an independent school of excellence, it has a pivotal role to play in both raising the level of education throughout the nation, and serving the community. We believe that our learners will go out into the world and spread their influence as ambassadors of our great nation. Description:
Admissions Enquiries Here Curro Castle offers a nursery school curriculum designed for the preschool child from 3 months to 4 years. It is based on the six Early Learning and Development Areas (ELDA) and stimulates and guide the young child to school readiness. ELDA cover the following: Physical well-being Identity and belonging Communication Mathematics Creativity Learning about the world Our babies and children of today will require particular skills to adapt to and solve challenges unknown to us. These skills are referred to as the 21st century skills, which comprise the three Rs, six Cs and two Ms. Two more Cs, Character and Citizenship, have been added to the original four Cs. These skills are incorporated into ELDA and promoted throughout each day. Curro Thatchfield practises a system of 'invitational education' in which learners are seen as able, valuable and responsible. Our ethos is governed by Christian values where learners are encouraged to explore and express their individuality within acceptable boundaries and ultimately take responsibility for their actions. We guide learners to follow their hearts and develop into the best people they can be.3512 Barbet Street cnr Brakfontein Road and, Barbet St, Thatchfield Hills, Centurion, 0014, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Sonrise is an English medium school situated in Green Avenue, Edleen, Kempton Park. We have a very dedicated staff serving the needs of our learners, from preschool & Grade R through Grade 12. Our raison d'etre is to provide an holistic approach to the education of children, imparting spiritual values which serve as foundation; providing an environment which promotes emotional well-being; stimulating and developing the child's physical interests and talents; and sharpening the life skills necessary for every child to become a mature, productive member of society. We follow the School of Tomorrow Accelerated Christian Education curriculum from grade R to grade 12. This trend setting educational model is revolutionary in that the focus is not on a teacher lecturing a large group of learners, but rather on the individual needs and abilities of each child. Our curriculum offers an excellent learning to read program in Grade R.  We offer small classes to ensure individual attention for each child.  Upon completion of grade 12 application is made for the Grade 12 certificate through Lighthouse Christian Academy (LCA) based in the USA.  This accredited grade 12 certificate is recognised for university admission in South Africa by the South African Quality Assurance body (SAQA) and many countries overseas.Granaat St, Edleen, Kempton Park, 1619, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 2:15 pmTuesday7:00 am - 2:15 pmWednesday7:00 am - 2:15 pmThursday7:00 am - 2:15 pmFriday7:00 am - 2:15 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
The Vine School offers a classic Ambleside curriculum, applying Charlotte Mason’s philosophy of education. In small classes of 16 children, teachers know each child personally. Their natural curiosity is engaged through “living books”, nature walks and great art & music. Classrooms are peaceful, attractive spaces where children are loved, accepted and supported in a non-competitive atmosphere. Teachers diligently train them to pay attention, take turns, listen to others, speak truthfully and practice self-control – all of which leads to success in learning. As a result, our children love to learn!The Vine School helps develop the minds and hearts of children in an atmosphere of joy where great ideas are pursued, so they can grow into adults prepared for a changeable future filled with work opportunities which haven’t even been thought of yet.Christian teachers provide outstanding education, inspiring children to think creatively and love learning, in an atmosphere of joyful discovery, using the Ambleside teaching method.37 Denver Rd, Lansdowne, Cape Town, 7780, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
Senior phase: Grade 8 and Grade 9In these grades, we guide learners to adjust to a greater workload of higher intensity. With dedicated teachers and small class sizes, our enhanced curriculum approach places great emphasis on problem-solving and individual thinking. At our school, 21st-century skills are implemented in subjects such as Technology, Robotics and Natural Sciences. As a Curro School, learners also receive guidance when choosing their elective subjects at the end of Grade 9. FET phase: Grade 10 to Grade 12This phase prepares learners for the IEB examinations written at the end of Grade 12. However, through our enhanced curriculum we emphasise a greater world-readiness rather than a purely examinations-driven approach. Learners in our small class sizes are taught to think innovatively, express their ideas and take charge of their own lives to be valued members of the community. Some of our specialised subjects to promote the development of 21st-century skills include Engineering Graphics and Design (EGD), Computer Applications Technology and Visual Arts. Description:
We strive to educate the learners to the highest standards and reach their full potential, enabling them to make a positive and valuable contribution to the community, their own future and the future of our country. We assist these learners to become well integrated so they can become contributing members of our society. School of Transformation was established to serve the needs of the community for a school that offers academic support within the Boksburg area. In 2004 we started in a house with only three pupils and have since grown to over 120 pupils. Needless to say, we outgrew our premises and were blessed to acquire and convert three houses into a learning facility. All three interlinking houses provide a homely environment which we are striving to maintain. School of Transformation follows the National Curriculum as prescribed by the Gauteng Education Department, in addition to having an Individualized Education Program (IEP) for each child specifically focused at his/her area of need. What we Cater for At School of Transformation, we cater for students with a variety of barriers to learning, including: ADHD Asperger Syndrome Dyslexia High Function Autism Emotional difficulties (supported through our mentoring programme and counselling).School of Transformation, Trichardts Road, Parkdene, Boksburg, South Africa, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed

Description:
The Latin word for "Let us dare" embodies the spirit and reality of Audeamus Private School and Activity Centre in eMalahleni, Mpumalanga. Driven by our philosophy that children need an enabling environment to flourish, we cut the keys that unlock each learner's individual potential. ? Why Audeamus Audeamus is a Dual Medium School (English and Afrikaans) where Children have the unique benefit of small classes (15 learners per class). Educators are highly trained in various areas of neurological and emotional development, and are able to devote their attention to every child, in one-on-one teaching. Educators adapt learning methods to "fit" each child, instead of expecting each child to "fit" the system. We form bonds of trust and understanding with each child, fostering a secure, enjoyable learning environment.Daily academic routines include exclusive forms of neurological stimulation. Activities which enhance the subtle, often neglected, core motor skills are also a vital part of our curriculum. Audeamus strives to create and maintain a comfortable, family-like atmosphere.53 Annie Rd, River View, Emalahleni, 1039, South AfricaMonday7:00 am - 3:00 pmTuesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmWednesday7:00 am - 3:00 pmThursday7:00 am - 3:00 pmFriday7:00 am - 3:00 pmSaturdayClosedSundayClosed
